info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 9 at 3:31AM EDT until July 9 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Wakefield VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following county, Chesterfield.
* WHEN...Until 600 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 331 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen since 2 AM. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moseley, Chester, Chesterfield Court House, Bellwood, Chesterfield, Beach, Winterpock, Pocahontas State Park, Skinquarter and Centralia. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Do not stay in areas subject to flooding when water begins rising.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING
